docTitle.titlePart:
Study of Water and Dimethylformamide Interaction
by Computer Simulation

front.div:
Monte Carlo simulations of water-dimethylformamide (DMF) mixtures were performed in the
isothermal and isobaric ensemble at 298.15 K and 1 atm. The intermolecular interaction energy
was calculated using the classical 6-12 Lennard-Jones pairwise potential plus a Coulomb term. The
TIP4P model was used for simulating water molecules, and a six-site model previously optimised by
us was used to represent DMF. The potential energy for the water-DMF interaction was obtained via
standard geomeU*ic combining rules using die original potential parameters for the pure liquids. The
radial disU-ibution functions calculated for water-DMF mixtures show well characterised hydrogen
bonds between the oxygen site of DMF and hydrogen of water. A structureless correlation curve
was observed for the interaction between die hydrogen site of the carbonyl group and die oxygen
site of water. Hydration effects on the stabilisation of die DMF molecule in aqueous solution have
been investigated using statistical perturbation theory. The results show that energetic changes
involved in the hydration process are not sttong enough to stabilise another configuration of DMF
than die planar one.
front.keywords:
Key words: Monte Carlo Simulation; Solvent Effects; Statistical Perturbation Theory; Hydration
of Peptides.
